messages.subject: Re: HSLDA Lawyers/Web Site was: HSLDA Paranoia
messages.msgSnippet: Date: Sun, 28 Nov 1999 08:43:09 -0800 From: Lynda  Subject: Re: Re: HSLDA Paranoia   They have 7 attorneys who are licensed at last
messages.messageBody:
Date: Sun, 28 Nov 1999 08:43:09 -0800
From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
Subject: Re: Re: HSLDA Paranoia

<SNIP> They have 7 attorneys who are licensed at last count to practice
in 11 states.>>>

They *say* they have a way around this. Can't remember the exact name.
Apparently, though, it ticks off the local judges.


<SNIP> half of what they have up on their website as hsing laws for
particular states is not accurate or is their own personal idea of what a
state law means and quite frequently way out in left field.>>>

That's true of their interpretation of VA laws. You'd think they'd at
least get it right in their home state. I doubt it's ignorance, though. I
think it's by design. Makes them--and their favored brand of
homeschooling-- sound more necessary.

-Shay
